meanings.definition: The quality of being assertive or aggressive in promoting oneself or one's ideas.
meanings.sent1: Her pushinesses in the meeting made everyone listen to her ideas.
meanings.sent2: I appreciate his pushinesses when it comes to advocating for equal rights.
meanings.sent3: His pushinesses in asking for a promotion were both annoying and effective.
meanings.sent4: The pushinesses of the salesperson were like a persistent knock on the door.
meanings.sent5: The politician's pushinesses on the campaign trail left a lasting impression on voters.

meanings.definition: The act of pushing or pressing something forcefully.
meanings.sent1: The pushinesses of the crowd against the barrier caused it to shake.
meanings.sent2: He used all his strength for the final pushinesses needed to open the jammed door.
meanings.sent3: The pushinesses of the child against the toy box resulted in a toppled tower of blocks.
meanings.sent4: The pushinesses of the wind against the window made it rattle loudly.
meanings.sent5: The pushinesses of the waves against the shore eroded the sand over time.

meanings.definition: The state of being overly persistent or intrusive in one's actions.
meanings.sent1: Her pushinesses in constantly asking for updates became bothersome.
meanings.sent2: The pushinesses of the paparazzi made it hard for the celebrity to have privacy.
meanings.sent3: The pushinesses of the squirrel trying to steal food from the bird feeder was comical.
meanings.sent4: The pushinesses of the weeds in the garden seemed to defy all efforts to remove them.
meanings.sent5: The pushinesses of the alarm clock in the morning always jolted him awake.
